A cluster munition consist of many bomblets which are scattered over wide areas, posing danger to civilians long after conflict ends.  

110 States are parties to the Convention on Cluster Munitions, which prohibits their use under any circumstances. https://t.co/i48coFIgYL https://t.co/x5qa8aBtrA
Ukraine: Calling for an immediate ceasefire, @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet warns that the conflict has opened a new and dangerous chapter in world history. https://t.co/aFFskWBUXX

Climate crisis 🌳
Nature & biodiversity loss 🐦🐟
Pollution & waste 🌊

@UNEP's 50th anniversary is an opportunity for collective action & cooperation to protect our planet & all its people. https://t.co/NA4brXBps3 #UNEP50 https://t.co/qUC1CdVT7G

Conflict is a key driver of hunger.

Our colleagues from @WFP are working to bring emergency food assistance to people affected by the violence in Ukraine.

Consider donating to help them reach the most vulnerable: https://t.co/C6PVpbCoqw

 https://t.co/GhtKOc5lwO

The world's biodiversity is in jeopardy. 

On Thursday's #WorldWildlifeDay, let's commit to creating a world that can sustain all life on Earth. 

See how YOU can help: https://t.co/rQm5KW878C
https://t.co/ok4vwFq5eN

460+ million people worldwide live with hearing loss, yet, many of the causes of hearing loss are preventable.

More from @WHO on Thursday's #WorldHearingDay: https://t.co/7x1VOE40HK https://t.co/znRnwYiX7Q

Over a million species of wild flora & fauna are threatened with extinction.

Thursday's #WorldWildlifeDay is an opportunity to seek solutions for creating more sustainable relationships between humans, nature & wildlife. https://t.co/LuyV8dFaal https://t.co/wkmZalXZeY

"Have not the Afghan people suffered enough?"
-- @DeborahLyonsUN asked Security Council on Wednesday. 

The @UNAMAnews chief addressed humanitarian & economic challenges & stressed the need for long-term relief & support from the international community.
https://t.co/vf7J1K9N2y https://t.co/UsjwHzyPdV

An estimated 240,000 newborns die within 4 weeks of birth every year due to birth defects and lack of access to quality care services.

On Thursday's World Birth Defects Day, @WHO has details on how to help prevent, detect and treat congenital anomalies: https://t.co/krKLORKSCC https://t.co/LxHrUdBppu

Continued species loss is a threat to people and planet. 

On Thursday's #WorldWildlifeDay, see how wildlife conservation can eliminate threats to biodiversity & benefit the #GlobalGoals: https://t.co/Gt7rSS7Y5Y https://t.co/Wr2IkBVof7

This cargo of 265,000 portions of High Energy Biscuits is prepared for airlift from @WFP's humanitarian response hub in Dubai to the Ukrainian - Polish border.

The biscuits will provide immediate nutrition to families affected by the conflict in Ukraine. https://t.co/QwSmU8AOsd https://t.co/geqJH0PUjf

141 in favor
   5 against
 35 abstentions

That was the result of Wednesday's vote concluding historic "Uniting for Peace" #UNGA session. 

The resolution demands that Russia immediately ceases use of force against Ukraine & withdraws its military forces. 
https://t.co/mkvny9F3LZ https://t.co/2GIuYV1Ccn

Ukraine: Ongoing conflict could jeopardize the safety of nuclear facilities warns @iaeaorg chief @rafaelmgrossi, reiterating the need for restraint and to ensure full safety of the power plants & their staff.
https://t.co/tEPejQdmxk

Stop killing and injuring children.
Children in Ukraine are being profoundly traumatized by the violence all around them.
They need peace now.
https://t.co/sETrcYCdJF via @UNICEF

 https://t.co/zjbXPLfYuT

Great #ClimateAction news: 

At the @UNEP Environment Assembly #UNEA5, governments agreed on a historic resolution to #BeatPlasticPollution.

This is the most important environmental deal since the #ParisAgreement. 
https://t.co/s0SYVsdu5j

"The message of the General Assembly is loud & clear:   
 
End hostilities in Ukraine — now.  
 
Silence the guns — now.   
 
Open the door to dialogue & diplomacy — now." 
 
-- @antonioguterres following historic #UNGA vote. https://t.co/5ust6qBEF9 https://t.co/t7BfHJMj8f

In historic "Uniting for Peace" session, #UNGA adopts resolution demanding that the Russian Federation immediately cease its use of force against Ukraine and withdraw its military forces. https://t.co/xWc4QO8ruV https://t.co/NZ5xG7Cfu2
Watch now: #UNGA votes on historic resolution on Ukraine. https://t.co/Ctm1VQybsO

Countries have pledged $1.5 billion on Tuesday to help the most vulnerable people in Ukraine, including refugees who fled to neighbouring countries.

This is among the fastest & most generous responses a humanitarian flash appeal has ever received.
https://t.co/miUZp4xHVq

"We need peace now." 

At an emergency meeting of the UN General Assembly on the situation in Ukraine, @antonioguterres said war is not the answer, as he called for an immediate end to the conflict. https://t.co/e5pbfyQlq6

In Ukraine, an estimated 80,000 women will give birth over the next 3 months.
Many of them will not have access to critical maternal health care. 

See how @UNFPA is taking action and what you can do to help: https://t.co/1Pam47sxVf https://t.co/fOnEmBvl9D

"The United Nations works every day, everywhere, to uphold and promote human rights for all."

-- @antonioguterres at Human Rights Council. https://t.co/JL3yfbu6qS https://t.co/9qPGzBKOuw

Humanitarian needs are rising steeply in Ukraine, as essential supplies and services are disrupted and civilians flee.

The UN has launched an emergency appeal for US $1.7 billion to urgently deliver humanitarian support.

More from @Refugees: https://t.co/kqk81798dU https://t.co/CxAkH4oIM4

"We are fully committed to staying & delivering for everyone affected by this deadly conflict across the country."

Amid the conflict in Ukraine, @antonioguterres joins humanitarians in calling for increased international support to help those in need. https://t.co/5aaU4gVGP3 https://t.co/vzcHCWlr8I

The fighting in Ukraine must stop.  

It must stop now.

Enough is enough. 

-- @antonioguterres. https://t.co/QvH6npozGI https://t.co/0ZXd0stLdo

Ending racism, discrimination, xenophobia and intolerance is our shared responsibility.

Every one of us can take action to end hatred and #FightRacism: https://t.co/PWxqEMAxTC https://t.co/gESMS9M3vM

Ukraine: Women & children are especially vulnerable to the devastating consequences of the ongoing conflict. 

@UNICEF is scaling up efforts to protect children in the country and warning that many young people are profoundly traumatized by the violence. https://t.co/Uvw96vq34P

Amid ongoing hostilities in Ukraine, 12 million people need urgent humanitarian assistance.

The UN has launched an emergency appeal for $1.7 billion to deliver aid to people inside Ukraine & to refugees who have fled to neighboring countries. https://t.co/g366psibFv https://t.co/R71OjNcQid

📷: The "Good Defeats Evil" Sculpture at UNHQ depicts St. George slaying a dragon created from fragments of nuclear missiles.

To achieve a peaceful and sustainable future, the world must be free of nuclear weapons. https://t.co/KrNaQYcfrN

Tuesday is #ZeroDiscrimination Day.

We can all play a part in ending discrimination.

Join @UNAIDS in demanding that governments remove laws & policies that prevent people from living full & productive lives. https://t.co/lwLcGaeBtL https://t.co/EUkf3c0jYb

What we share online can have consequences in the real world.

Spreading misinformation can can result in people being left uninformed, unprotected & can put lives at risk during a crisis.

#PledgeToPause and verify facts before sharing. https://t.co/qFqoh7loX2 https://t.co/6R2ZR6uJQg

#UNEA5, @UNEP's Environment Assembly, kicked off Monday in Nairobi. 

Get live updates on the progress made #ForNature, for climate, for jobs, for food, for health & for sustainability here: https://t.co/DXKTmAEI3f

"Investments in adaptation work.

Adaptation saves lives.

As climate impacts worsen – and they will – scaling up investments will be essential for survival."

-- @antonioguterres following release of new @IPCC_CH climate report. https://t.co/Fjm6b5EJkz #ClimateAction https://t.co/aX0E8Edz6j

United Arab Emirates assumes the rotating presidency of the Security Council for the month of March.

Follow @UAEMissionToUN for updates. https://t.co/OgiMIxUs5a https://t.co/bMPEK0RaVo

No one should be excluded from essential services or subject to undue restrictions simply because of who they are, where they come from or how they live their life.

Tuesday is #ZeroDiscrimination Day. https://t.co/lwLcGawcSl https://t.co/TqlPEIpxCE

“The violence must stop. Humanitarian law and international humanitarian law must be respected. And diplomacy and dialogue must prevail.” 

-- @UN_PGA at #UNGA Emergency Special Session on Ukraine. https://t.co/vSqMXzIfFS

“I have worked in refugee crises for almost 40 years and I have rarely seen such an incredibly fast exodus of people."

-- @FilippoGrandi briefs Security Council on how @Refugees is responding to conflict in Ukraine. https://t.co/5oGneJIarW

War is not the answer.

It is death, human suffering, senseless destruction & an immense distraction from the real challenges facing humanity.

The only true solution is peace. 

-- @antonioguterres tells #UNGA Emergency Special Session on Ukraine. https://t.co/QvH6npozGI https://t.co/dYvUxIMphO

Now is the time to accelerate the energy transition. 

A prompt, well-managed transition to renewables is the only pathway to energy security, universal access & the green jobs our world needs.

-- @antonioguterres on release of @IPCC_CH climate report. https://t.co/Fjm6b5n8t1 https://t.co/vRsfY49B3M

"I am grateful for the compassion, generosity & solidarity of Ukraine’s neighbours taking in those seeking safety."

At #UNGA emergency special session, @antonioguterres urged countries to show solidarity to those fleeing conflict, without discrimination. https://t.co/0Pi4brX762

"The mere idea of a nuclear conflict is simply inconceivable.

Nothing can justify the use of nuclear weapons."

-- @antonioguterres at #UNGA special session on situation in Ukraine. https://t.co/QvH6np6Yi8 https://t.co/Yvmbkd7CrH

#UNGA observes a minute of silence during Emergency Special Session on Ukraine.

"The General Assembly represents the collective conscience of humanity," said @UN_PGA. https://t.co/AglnCSHQsO https://t.co/MuuALXUr8O

The fighting in Ukraine must stop.  

It must stop now.

Enough is enough. 

-- @antonioguterres tells #UNGA Emergency Special Session that escalating violence is totally unacceptable. https://t.co/QvH6npozGI https://t.co/qPQcxQikHh

More than 500,000 refugees have now fled from Ukraine into neighbouring countries.

UNHCR is working with partners & local authorities to provide humanitarian aid & support those in need. 

You can support their efforts: https://t.co/fPXMh4H71T via @Refugees https://t.co/ZZH7wUXdln

"Human rights cannot be confiscated by dictators or erased by poverty.    
Nor are they a luxury that can be left for later.   
They are inescapable – and powerful." 

-- @antonioguterres at Human Rights Council. 
https://t.co/JL3yfbLHPs https://t.co/UOBffUQLyB

Ukraine: For the 1st time since 1982, the UN Security Council has called for a #UNGA Emergency Special Session, to be held on Monday

Get details on sessions based on the "Uniting for Peace" resolution here: https://t.co/EVQ5Nyjlok https://t.co/Q8f7hurjwD

"Every fraction of a degree matters.
Every voice can make a difference.
And every second counts."

-- @antonioguterres renews his call for urgent #ClimateAction following release of new @IPCC_CH climate report. https://t.co/Fjm6b5n8t1 https://t.co/SrXt0a44qb

Conflict is the utter negation of human rights.

We must show all people of Ukraine that we stand by them in their time of need. 

-- @antonioguterres at Human Rights Council. https://t.co/xXxqoafc6v

Ukraine: @UNFPA has been working in the country for decades, helping to expand access to reproductive health & protection services. 

Despite the challenging environment, they plan to stay & scale up the delivery of life-saving programmes. https://t.co/SzFbXrLUzp https://t.co/l0qBEpKUAU

This week, @UNEP's Environment Assembly #UNEA5 will focus on strengthening action

🟢 #ForNature
🟢 For climate
🟢 For jobs 
🟢 For food 
🟢 For health
🟢 For sustainability

Details: https://t.co/M0oY2WP7V5 https://t.co/kQEAZYT9F5

Millions of women, children & men worldwide have been forced to flee, leaving everything behind to save themselves.

Seeking asylum is a fundamental human right for people facing violence, persecution or war at home. https://t.co/rtosk2ky10 via @Refugees https://t.co/M6GSf2FGIc
Ukraine: The Security Council voted on Sunday to call for a rare #UNGA emergency special session, which will be held on Monday. https://t.co/HI2CemVwMo

📷: The "Good Defeats Evil" Sculpture at UNHQ depicts St. George slaying a dragon created from fragments of nuclear missiles.

To achieve a peaceful and sustainable future, the world must be free of nuclear weapons. https://t.co/fP4QLnDqPy

Ukraine: For the 1st time since 1982, the UN Security Council has called for a #UNGA Emergency Special Session, to be held on Monday. 

Get background information on such sessions here: https://t.co/ecRL3ABUsU https://t.co/HwLi0aK8lX

On Monday, the 49th session of the Human Rights Council gets underway. 

Get updates here and on @UN_HRC https://t.co/AFnXl0igeb. #StandUp4HumanRights
 https://t.co/TtMgEL5rZ7

When and how is a new @UNPeacekeeping operation formed?

The Security Council decides on new missions and their mandates. 

Get more details here: https://t.co/yS5VxBxyfr https://t.co/4tKQZBJ2v5

The spread of misinformation during a crisis can be dangerous.

❌ Don't share rumours.
✅ Choose content verified by reliable sources.

#PledgetoPause and check the facts before sharing content online. https://t.co/qFqoh7CZOA https://t.co/0EdOiVnoR1

Ending discrimination benefits everyone.

As #BlackHistoryMonth comes to an end, we can all reflect on how we can prevent and #FightRacism, and create a better world for all. 

Get ideas for actions you can take to stand up for our common humanity: https://t.co/PWxqEMAxTC https://t.co/ZE4Fq5z0KZ

📸: Original manuscript of the UN Charter (1945). 

The use of force by one country against another is wrong & against the Charter.

This week, @antonioguterres stressed that the values of the Charter must prevail: "We must never give up." https://t.co/uM2jg7tqv8

💻tech expert
👩🏾‍💼lawyer

👨🏿‍🎓student

Learn how you can join them as an online volunteer: https://t.co/tfDcH9FPWu https://t.co/XPKKujrYYb

"The United Nations Charter has been challenged in the past, but it has stood firm on the side of peace, security, development, justice, international law & human rights."

-- @antonioguterres following Friday's Security Council meeting on Ukraine. https://t.co/TOCcBZIhl8 https://t.co/vED7mN6B3n

The children of Ukraine need peace.
Desperately.
Now. 

As hostilities intensify, @UNICEF is scaling up support for children. https://t.co/p4pWNt2TXF https://t.co/NisIKBVhA6

📸: Picasso's “Guernica” tapestry is displayed outside the Security Council at UNHQ. Its looming presence is a reminder of the devastation of war - and the urgent need for peace. https://t.co/l1a3PDkHWc

Now is the time for an unprecedented surge in investment in renewable energy; creating jobs and saving money & lives.

#ClimateAction is not only the right thing to do, it's also the smart thing to do. https://t.co/X0sBPypDO9 https://t.co/taaSN4jRLc

The UN is made up of dedicated women & men around the world who:

🇺🇳 Feed the hungry
🇺🇳 Vaccinate children
🇺🇳 Promote development
🇺🇳 Protect civilians
🇺🇳 Mediate conflicts
🇺🇳 Support refugees & migrants
🇺🇳 Advance human rights
🇺🇳 Stay & deliver to give hope to those in need https://t.co/gzrI7ZyZxN

"We spend much more money & resources managing conflicts than on preventing them & building peace."

-- @antonioguterres called for strengthened investment in conflict prevention and peacebuilding when outlining action areas for 2022. https://t.co/8yxiWr6mpM https://t.co/G3YeX2vB8z

Ukraine: Children are experiencing fear & uncertainty as conflict grips the country.

@UNICEF warns that continued violence could leave an entire generation with lasting psychological damage. https://t.co/m3S0nWIP7L

When the international community has rallied together behind peace, security, development, justice & human rights, those values have prevailed. 

We must do everything so that they prevail in Ukraine & for all humanity, says @antonioguterres. https://t.co/RbbvbGd0ls https://t.co/tiAiRns06b

"The United Nations was born out of war to end war. 
Today, that objective was not achieved.  
But we must never give up.
We must give peace another chance."  

-- @antonioguterres following Security Council meeting on Ukraine. https://t.co/TOCcBZIhl8 https://t.co/1TOfisb6FK

“If the pandemic has shown us anything, it is the importance of collective action – that our strength lies in solidarity."

-- @UN_PGA at #UNGA meeting on the need for global vaccine equity to end #COVID19. https://t.co/ZVQ8y5z51x

📸: Original manuscript of the UN Charter (1945). 

The use of force by one country against another is wrong & against the Charter.

On Thursday, @antonioguterres repeated his appeal to President Putin: "Stop the military operation in Ukraine." https://t.co/2IGtLEKrLt https://t.co/9w76HQ4QmB

https://t.co/sNhBAAcxTv

Amid the conflict in Ukraine, @UNICEF is scaling up support by prepositioning health, hygiene & emergency education supplies across the country, providing social care & more. 

But more than anything, the children of Ukraine need peace, now. 
https://t.co/aonGR7UR9h https://t.co/6HQyzGt7nM

"It is urgent for Iraq’s political leaders to overcome divisions, to put aside partisanship & to bury personal vendettas." 

@JeanineHennis, head of @UNIraq, tells Security Council. https://t.co/hKuy551ba9 https://t.co/tWaovvn65b

UN officials condemn killing of 8 polio vaccination workers in Afghanistan this week.

Attacks against health care workers are a violation of international humanitarian law & hinder the ability for children to gain protection from disease. #NotATarget
https://t.co/gDVSvr73xQ

"We and our humanitarian partners are committed to staying and delivering, to support people in Ukraine in their time of need."

-- @antonioguterres says protection of civilians must be priority number one. 
https://t.co/x3kzyQdCy2

Ukraine: As crisis escalates, @WFP is ready to provide humanitarian assistance to those in need.

Conflict is a main driver in nearly all major hunger emergencies leading to devastating impacts on millions of lives. https://t.co/82Jd7n9JGt

 https://t.co/zgwxLXzgyh

The present offensive in Ukraine is wrong.
It is against the UN Charter.
It is unacceptable.
But it is not irreversible.

@antonioguterres repeats his appeal to President Putin to stop the military operation and bring the troops back to Russia. https://t.co/2IGtLEKrLt https://t.co/rMmqeSlGcb

The children of Ukraine need peace.
Desperately.
Now.

The Democratic Republic of the Congo has the world's highest number of acutely food insecure people.

“There is no substitute for a legitimate political process that will resolve the core issues driving the conflict." 

UN Middle East Coordinator stresses need for firm action that will allow Israelis & Palestinians to re-engage in meaningful negotiations. https://t.co/87pzKXgXbL

"President Putin, in the name of humanity, bring your troops back to Russia.

This conflict must stop now."

-- @antonioguterres on the developments regarding Ukraine. https://t.co/QYDflm1Co5 https://t.co/s3aWCHWHYZ

The #COVID19 pandemic has led to an increased number of women isolated in abusive relationships. 

Learn about the signs of abuse & tips to get help for yourself or others. https://t.co/gOH8wqcRHp via @UN_Women https://t.co/tIglv2OqLE

For more than 73 years, @UNPeacekeeping has helped create a more peaceful & prosperous world.

Despite personal risks, the men & women #ServingForPeace work to protect the most vulnerable, provide security for humanitarian aid, promote human rights & more. https://t.co/1AkYG6N3nb https://t.co/YDwhEGQrOH

"It is time to establish a ceasefire and return to the path of dialogue and negotiations to save the people in Ukraine and beyond from the scourge of war."

-- @antonioguterres tells #UNGA.  
https://t.co/8lcEtCzlz1 https://t.co/b3M4syRroX

The climate crisis & land-use change are projected to make wildfires more frequent & intense.

@UNEP explains how wildfires affect lives & livelihoods and impede progress towards the #GlobalGoals: https://t.co/AmvPMlOyy8 https://t.co/4AwZPEap0h

"We cannot and will not relent in the search for a peaceful solution."

At #UNGA meeting on the situation regarding Ukraine, @antonioguterres says he is fully committed to ending the crisis without further bloodshed. https://t.co/EOcju4V5SE https://t.co/4hYcT6Gt94

Around the world, the number of people teetering on the verge of famine continues to grow due to going conflicts, the climate crisis & the effects of #COVID19.

Learn more about @WFP's work to fight famine & how you can help. https://t.co/0VRxfLiP2M
 https://t.co/ACuwR0q7GQ

Learn about their efforts to protect those disproportionately harmed by desertification; including rural communities, farmers & the extremely poor. #UNEP50 https://t.co/woY98GjxA9

"It is high time to return to the path of dialogue & negotiations."

-- @antonioguterres, deeply troubled by latest developments regarding Ukraine, calls for an immediate ceasefire. https://t.co/4INuf6CNTH

Central African Republic: Long-awaited local elections could provide an opportunity to decentralize power & ease tensions.

Head of @UN_CAR urges Government to make every effort to calm political climate in the country. https://t.co/huCaxNh38U

Madagascar is bracing for its 4th severe storm in a month with the arrival of Tropical Cyclone #Emnati.

Humanitarian agencies are already on the ground & preparing to provide additional aid to those already reeling from weeks of devastating weather. https://t.co/pxbQr2iia4

"At this critical moment, I call for an immediate ceasefire and re-establishment of the rule of law.  

We need restraint and reason. We need de-escalation now."

-- @antonioguterres on developments regarding Ukraine. https://t.co/9mIXqdGdjn

Ukraine: "I am deeply concerned that any significant escalation in military action creates a heightened risk of serious human rights violations as well as violations of international humanitarian law."  

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet. https://t.co/QaqOl5P00o

📷: The UN emblem - pictured here in the #UNGA Hall - is an inspirational symbol that represents people's hopes and dreams for a world united for peace.
